Meanwhile, Lisa had been busy taking care of her beloved house cat, Ruffles. One day, while she was out grocery shopping, Ruffles managed to escape through an open window. Lisa was beside herself with worry and searched high and low for her furry friend. Luckily, she caught Ruffles just in time before anything bad could happen.

Rob's hard work paid off, and he was able to prevent the measure from being implemented. The city council was forced to listen to the voices of the community, and they had no choice but to back down. Rob felt proud of what he had accomplished and knew that he had made a difference.

As for Lisa and Ruffles, they continued to enjoy their peaceful life in the small town, grateful for the efforts of people like Rob who cared about their community and worked hard to make it a better place.

outline: Sam saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich.

Sam had always been a picky eater, turning his nose up at anything that seemed remotely adventurous. This included his brother Barry's favorite snack, a peanut butter and banana sandwich. Sam would watch in disgust as Barry would take a bite, the creamy peanut butter and sweet banana melding together in his mouth. 

One day, as Sam was sitting at the kitchen table, he saw Barry walk in with a sandwich. "Hey Sam," Barry said with a mouthful of food, "you should try this sandwich. It's amazing." Sam wrinkled his nose and shook his head. "No way, that looks gross." 

Meanwhile, Holly had always been interested in the field of public health. She had interned at various organizations throughout her undergraduate years, and her grades reflected her passion for the subject. She had always dreamed of pursuing a Master's degree in the field, and her hard work paid off when she was accepted into a prestigious graduate program. 

Back in the kitchen, Barry shrugged and continued eating his sandwich. Sam watched him curiously, wondering what could possibly be so good about it. Finally, he gave in and took a small bite. To his surprise, it was actually pretty good. He took another bite, and then another, until the whole sandwich was gone. 

From that day on, Sam started making himself a peanut butter and banana sandwich every week. As for Holly, she worked hard in graduate school and eventually landed her dream job in public health. Barry may have introduced Sam to a new snack, but it was Holly who inspired him to pursue his passions, just like she had.

As they lounged on the sand, sipping their drinks and enjoying the atmosphere, Cindy couldn't help but feel grateful that she had finally decided to join in on the fun. That's when she noticed Nellie, one of her coworkers, sound asleep next to them, her face buried in the sand.

Cindy giggled at the sight, but her laughter quickly turned to shock as Nellie's little brother revealed himself from behind a nearby sand dune. He had buried Nellie in sand while she was sleeping, and she was completely unaware of her predicament.

The group erupted in laughter as they helped Nellie wiggle her way out of the sand. Cindy felt like she had finally become a part of the group, and she was grateful for the memories they were making together. Larry followed the sound and found Kelly sitting on the couch, tears streaming down her face. He immediately went to her side and asked her what was wrong. Kelly told him that she had just returned from getting her nails done, but her nail technician had made a mistake, ruining her manicure.

Larry listened patiently to her, comforting her as best as he could. He knew how much Kelly loved getting her nails done and how important it was to her. Jason called Chris and begged him to come over and help. He knew that Chris was the only one who could navigate the flooded basement and save their belongings. 

To Jason's surprise, Chris agreed to come over right away. He arrived within minutes and quickly got to work, wading through the water to salvage everything he could. 

Despite his fear, Chris was determined to keep his promise to his worker. He worked tirelessly until everything was safe and dry.

outline: Joel was very stingy with his money.
Lola was planning to go to the beach with her husband.
Joel never took vacations or bought things for Joel.

Joel had always been known for his penny-pinching ways. He never spent a dime more than he needed to and was always on the lookout for a good deal. This was all well and good when he was working, but now that he was retired, Joel was starting to regret his stinginess.

One day, Joel's wife, Lola, came to him with an idea. She had been planning a beach vacation for the two of them and was excited to finally get away. But when Joel heard the cost of the trip, he immediately shut it down. "We can't afford that," he told her flatly.

Lola was disappointed but didn't say anything. She knew that Joel had never been one to splurge on himself, even when he could afford it. She hoped that maybe he would change his mind and surprise her with a trip someday, but it never happened.

Years went by, and Joel's regrets started to weigh on him. He had spent so much time worrying about money that he had missed out on experiences with his wife. He wished he could go back and do things differently.

One day, as Lola was flipping through old photo albums, Joel saw a picture of her at the beach. She looked so happy and carefree, and he realized how much he had missed out on. "I'm sorry," he said to her. "I should have taken you on that trip. I should have done more for us."

Lola smiled at him, knowing that he meant it. "It's okay," she said. "We can still make up for lost time." And with that, Joel made a promise to himself to be more adventurous, to take more risks, and to never let money stand in the way of making memories with the people he loved.
eval_result:
90

The subplot of Lola planning a beach vacation is closely integrated with the main narrative of Joel's regret over his stinginess. Lola's disappointment when Joel refuses to go on the trip serves as a catalyst for Joel's realization of his missed opportunities and his decision to change his ways. The subplot is not entirely indispensable, as Joel's regret could have been triggered by other events, but it significantly enriches the main narrative and provides a concrete example of the consequences of Joel's penny-pinching ways.
